definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: In fact, I have to say that I love you baby.
sentences.chinese: 其实我有话要说，就是宝贝我爱你。

sentences.english: Don't whisper; if you've got something to say, say it out loud.
sentences.chinese: 别嘀咕了，如果有话要说就大声说出来吧。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid to call on those who may look like they want to speak.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕去叫那些看起来有话要说的同学作答。

sentences.english: It seems that she had something to say but stopped for some reason.
sentences.chinese: 看她的样子好象有话要说，却总是欲言又止。

sentences.english: There's something to be said in favor of privacy.
sentences.chinese: 支持保护隐私的人也有话要说。

sentences.english: So if you have something to say.
Everyone had something to say, me included.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都有话要说，包括我。

sentences.english: Ray: I have something to say , Jenny.
I saw ten thousand talkers whose tongues were all broken.
sentences.chinese: 我看到千万人有话要说，舌头却被割去。

sentences.english: If you have something to say， speak up.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有话要说，尽管开口说出来。

sentences.english: But wait a moment, the Fed's critics say.
sentences.chinese: 但是请稍等会儿，美联储的评论家们还有话要说。

sentences.english: Mitch McConnell might even have something to say about China policy at that point.
sentences.chinese: 麦康奈尔甚至可能有话要说，在这一点上中国的政策。

sentences.english: If you have something to say, speak up.
sentences.chinese: 假如你有话要说，尽管说话说出来。
